creator: Riel, Louis, 1844-1885. (author)
Guay, Abraham (editor)
description: Riel, Louis: 1844-1885. Métis leader; president of provisional government at Red River, 1869-1870; escaped with arrival of Wolseley's forces; elected to House of Commons to represent Provencher, 1873 and 1874, but unable to sit; declared an outlaw, 1875; lived in Montana until invited by Métis to the Saskatchewan country, 1884; executed at Regina, November 16, 1885. // Also published, [Toronto]: Canadiana House, 1970 (51p.); Saint-Boniface, Man.: Éditions des Plaines, 1979 (51p.).
subject: Literary Works--Poetry, French
Poetry, French Canadian
Canadian poetry (French)
Poésie canadienne-française
title: Poésies religieuses et politiques
